definition[0]: to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger
example[1]: an area patrolled by special police units
definition[1]: to drive or walk around an area in a threatening way
example[2]: Gangs of youths patrolled the streets at night.
definition[2]: when someone goes around different parts of an area at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger
example[3]: The security forces increased their patrols in the area.
example[4]: police on patrol in the city centre
definition[3]: a group of police, soldiers, vehicles, planes etc sent out to search a particular area
note[1]: patrol boat/car (=used by the army or police)
definition[4]: a small group of boy scouts or Guides
